result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A. Erwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Paragon Potato Farms, Inc-$40 bi-weekly starting 04-19-2016

All Cases Called @ 3:09 PM: Defendant Richard A. Erwin in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today and is prepared to resolve these matters.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 15CM-383 Ct 1 (OAR) Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.   15TR-2593 Plea:  NC 15TR-2594 Plea:  NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.    State notes for the record that it appears that Def would be eligible for reinstatement upon completion of assessment.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Imposes Court Costs only with DNA Surcharge.  Sample to be provided today.  Expungement process with DOJ explained to Def.  Appeal Rights Given.
